page.title: 06Housing:Lancing
page.content: { The village of Lancing is actually two communities-North & South Lancing.The orginal centre was North Lancing with it's Norman church,Manor and cluster of farm houses.The inhabitants were known as 'Rooks'. There was no nucleus in South Lancing-just a single street called 'steetend' that led to the beach.The inhabitants were known as 'seagulls'.Only fields and orchards lay between the two villages. In the last fifty years there has been agreat change.The manor has been sold and houses have been built on the fields.Industry has taken over from farming. In North Lancing there are some very old tudor houses.Thay timber frames that may have came from the broken ships of the Spanish Armada.
